CatDescriptText: Lou Toth, Main Street, Belle Vernon, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 24, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that the increasing demand for father and mother to work, thus taking both parents out of the home for the better part of the day, affects their children as regards discipline, ambition, and social compatibility in general?" answer reads: "I believe that it does.  In my opinion the wife should stay at home because she has a lot to do while the man goes out and earns a living."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Lou Toth, wearing light colored hat, plaid shirt, and light colored jacket, holding child, with another child standing beside them, on Liberty Avenue with Baum Building sign in background, Downtown
